page.title: 14Mr Hiscocks' Market Garden
page.content: Mr Hiscock has fourteen acres of land, and grows seventeen types of crops. He's lived at The Glen, Holt Wood, Holt, for sixty-three years. He has two cats and one dog. {A DAY AT MR HISCOCKS' MARKET GARDEN Mr Hiscock gets up at 5-00am and checks the poultry. On Tuesdays, Thursdays and Fridays cuts down lettuce and delivers it to Wimborne, on the same day if he's lucky. Other days he prepares and plants see3ds. Mr Hiscock used to take a horse and cart int Wimborne but now he uses a van. {MR HISCOCKS' HOME LIFE IN HOLT The thing he enjoys most about Holt is the peace and quiet of the village. His daughter owns a horse called Misprint. Mr Hiscock keeps him in a field next to his market garden. .
